name: Neil Gealy
content: Provides helpful information in a clear and concise manner.  Lots of hands on experience.  Very up to date with the latest technology

name: Rizki Pranata
content: Great course, covered up all the things that i didn't explore on docker, such us docker swarm, docker stack, docker secret, and else.also updated my old habit how to use docker, such as new command like docker container, and etc.

name: Leonid Rise
content: Very informative course, well explained examples and going through a lot of topics. Recommended to everyone looking to extend his knowledge on Docker.

name: Andy Edward
content: Excellent course. Step by step explanation. Excellent assignments. I am a web developer and implementing docker containers has changed my workflow so much for the better..Thank you Bret for being a good instructor..

name: Ruben Gomez
content: This course is excellent to learn what docker can do for you as developer or dev ops. The instructor is very knowledgeable about the topic. The only think I missed is maybe at the beginning, an explanation of how docker works under the hood. Also it would be great an example of how a swarm cluster can scale when the overall resources are close to 100%, if it is even possible

name: Evren Sen
content: One of the best online courses I have ever experienced. There are several sections that build foundational skills and get more advanced. The length of the course sessions is very reasonable; helping finishing sections in a busy personal schedule. Assignments are also very well positioned after each major section. If you are new to containers; or close the knowledge gap; you can not miss this one.

name: Naveen Sankar Regatipalli
content: Great but felt if explanation was more eloborative i.e. for freshers if u can explain what ever you are doing that might be very helpful

name: Jeremy Collins
content: This is an excellent class on Docker. The assignments do a great job of throwing you out into the wilderness with just enough info to find your way home. It's valuable, real-world experience. The class also covers services, stacks, and secrets in good depth and this is the first time I've seen these topics covered. Great stuff!

name: Justin Davidson
content: Bret is a fantastic teacher. He has taken something that is quite complex and explained it, in detail, in a clear and easy to understand manner. He is always very responsive within the in-course chat should you need any assistance or clarification. Thanks for taking the time to put this together Bret! A fantastic course and I can't wait to see what you publish in the future!

name: Jon Cole
content: Great course! Taken me from having limited docker knowledge to feeling comfortable with many/most docker commands and docs. The final video is especially interesting as it shows how dev/test/prod environments can work together when using docker. The assignments are also helpful to make sure that the topics discussed have been understood correctly.

name: Jose Luis Montaña Hernandez
content: It was a very complete course. The final part about how to go from, development to testing and then to production was a good plus!!.Thanks!

name: Bklau
content: A few things as feedback:1. It would be nice to have more diagrams instead of the free-hand drawing. A digram is worth a thousand words2. Would like to  see a bit more emphasis on Docker networking which seems a bit magical.3. Some Docker Swarm best practices.

name: Joseph Reymann
content: It was so good, I kinda felt like Neo in The Matrix after his first experience with the training program when he says,  "Whoa, I know Kung Fu!"  So, whoa, I know Docker!

name: Andrew woodward
content: Loving the approach and the assignments, really getting into the power of Docker with this course.  The depth the course goes into is great looking at not just Docker but Swarm and Stacks and how you move from dev to prod.

name: Scott Grimes
content: Excellent video over the whole course.Excellent audio, and instructor pace for the initial concepts.The quality of the audio gets "softer" as you move to the advanced sections on docker-compose and and swam.  In combination, Bret starts to talk much faster making it difficult to grasp the technical detail at the rate he's covering them.  (I suspect he was anxious to finish the course and publish.)  To compensate, I've had to backup often and re-listen 2 or even 3 times to what was said combined with frequent pauses to just read the screen content to better grasp the volume of advanced docker capabilities that's being rapidly covered.  Nonetheless, the course is still the most efficient/effective way I know to come up to speed on this new technology.  Hence, it remains 4 stars.  Nice job Bret.

name: J
content: Great course for beginners; also has a few tips and tricks for more advanced Docker users. Content is very practical and instructor is able to explain Docker concepts clearly.

name: Oleksandr (Alex) Miroshnyk
content: For sure, one of the most interesting and solid training I have ever watched. However, from my point of view, it should be more assignments and they should be much more complicated. But yeah, 5 of 5

name: Darren Khan
content: The course was informative and well planned.  Great for a beginner or someone who has tried Docker but not in an enterprise environment.

name: Gautron Dominique
content: explications très claires et faciles à suivre. Je connaissais très peu l'environnement docker et j'ai pu suivre sans problème. Je suis passé à travers l'ensemble du contenu de ce cours. C'est assez impressionnant, je dirais même étourdissant.Beaucoup de contenu. Très bien expliqué. Il me reste beaucoup de travail à faire pour en profiter pleinement. très motivant! merci!Félicitations!

name: John Webb
content: The instructor does a great job of explaining Docker & Docker Swarm concepts. There are a couple of sections that could use more content which would allow the participants to be more successful with completing the assignments.

name: Dan Martin
content: Lots of good up to date information, from the basics of a container and images to running a production swarm. Good lecturer and relevant assignments.

name: Victor Melnik
content: It's a quite fast way to get understanding of all main Docker concepts and available tools in its stack.

name: Ross Faulds
content: Bret covers the information thoroughly with lots of samples/exercises and exercise solutions. I feel i have a thorough understanding of docker and look forward to putting what i have  learnt into practice.

name: Carlos Esteban Feria Vila
content: First at all, this course is well explained not just for beginners but for developers with some time working with docker. On the other hand the teacher helps actively on chat and QA.

name: Nick Aslanidis
content: This was an excellent course for people looking to gain a better understanding of docker, docker compose and swarm and should set you up to then dig deeper into each topic of interest.

name: Todd Stephens
content: Very good course.  Especially liked how the labs were done.  Allowed you to try first based on the lectures, then provided a solution.

name: Carl Hurd
content: This was a really great class about Docker. I feel that I have learned enough that if I had to use Docker I would be comfortable doing so at a fairly advanced level. All of the information is really great and the push toward documentation is something I don't see enough when people teach. Bret is a great instructor and while it may not be important to some people, his voice is not one that gets annoying half way into the first lecture.

name: Juan David Sánchez
content: I was looking for a course that helps me solve some problems for speeding up development, and ensuring consistent environments for my team, and this course has definitely taken me closer to that goal.Explanations are clear and concise. The assignments help to practice what has been explained and the review sections at the end of some of the lectures are a good summary of the key take-aways of what has been taught.Thank you for this great course!

name: Chris Puzzuoli
content: Excellent overview of basic Docker commands and functionality. Plenty of resources provided for further learning.

name: Michael Angelo
content: One of the best courses that I've taken on Udemy! Bret has a great style that really helps the course contents sink in!

name: Ryan Bonial
content: Fantastic course. It isn't just the Docker commands, he covers the scenarios you would use the commands, best practices, applies it to real world examples,  and covers common mistakes.

name: Jason Whitaker
content: The pacing and delivery are excellent, with plenty of links provided for further digging. The enthusiasm of the presenter is clear to see.

name: Jakub Zukal
content: 5 sections in and this course is great. Excellent explanation of fundamentals (containers, images) and how to work with them. I already moved some services into docker and applied better workflow and it made my life a little bit easier.

name: Jakob Scheck
content: The course provides a good not too deep overview of Docker with a reasonable range of covered topics.

name: Ezimet Yusup
content: absolutely great course I recommend you to learn it if you are interested in docker and new to docker!

name: Nitin Kotian
content: Bret has done an excellent job on this course. I highly recommend this course for beginners.

name: Andrea Bongiovanni
content: Excellent course, with a lot of clear explanations and effective samples

name: Ryan Wesslen
content: Clear, concise, straight-forward and easy to get started. I was amazed how much I learned so quickly without any previous experience with Docker.

name: Neil Bottomley
content: Great course, ideal for for linux sysadmins and those familiar with vmware. Starts from the ground up, everything explained in simple terms, easy to follow and appropriate practical workshops along the way.

name: glenn opdycke-hansen
content: it is important to be on the current version of docker.  I got help to upgrade from 1.12 to 1.13 or current version: Docker version 17.03.1-ce

name: Ray Jones
content: Thanks! Very clear and exactly what I needed to understand Docker

name: Rod
content: Very well prepared course: easy to follow, explanations are excellent, exercises are good (not too much of a stretch to put one off).

name: Sourav Das
content: Very informative. Starts from the basics and scales up to the swarm. Love this course. A must have for people who want to learn Docker.

name: Matthias Lemmer
content: This is the best course i have ever taken on Udemy. I totally get the point behind the learning topic and the small but smart assignments in the right spots help to memorize the key processes and commands while fullfilling a real task.

name: Eli Vogel
content: It's hard to get around the typos. Granted we all make mistakes this is a recording and could be corrected. Your vs. You're - their, they're and there. It drives me crazy and distracts me. I'm really feeling good about the material. It's kind of a shame

name: Javier Mora
content: Great information and training, I've been easily keeping up with the coarse being new to Docker and I'm really excited about the technology!

name: William Collins
content: Each lecture is presented in a clear and iterative way. Each new concept is delivered one at a time, and assignments are both relevant and well reviewed afterwards.

name: Andrei Pinta
content: Clear explanations and examples. The assignments are great and make me think more about the subjects presented.

name: Gregory Drake
content: This course definitely gives you a broad sense of what Docker can do.  I'd definitely suggest using the official Docker.com documents alongside this course to help gain the most thorough understanding of the Docker tool. Great course for any level of developer, but I suggest taking about an hour prior to starting the course in order to brush up on bash and shell skills.

name: Slaven Krilic
content: The course is very well balanced, lessons last enough to not be boring. Audio and video quality are also very good

name: Alexandru Saramet
content: Very detailed and helpful course. Can't imagine myself developing web apps, without docker, anymore. Real life changer. Thank you.

name: Oscar Hernandez
content: I've been using Docker since few months ago. I've only used Docker for running single containers for dev purpose and compose to dockerize existing proyects. But I really wanted to get a better explanation of Docker's true power and also wanted to take a peek about swarming. This course fits just what I need.

name: John DiGerolamo
content: I have very basic knowledge of networking, Linux terminal, and what Docker is/does. This course has made understanding the concept of Docker and the related concepts incredibly easy to understand and relate to one another. I need to learn Docker and Docker Compose for a job I will be starting in 2 weeks and this course has thus far been an amazing resource. I will feel confident in my ability walking in on that first day.

name: Charlie Baum
content: This is the best docker course I've seen or heard about.  The depth and simple way that everything within Docker is explained and shown makes it very easy to learn.  This course includes more of the built in Docker features than any Docker udemy course I've gone through.  This is the only one you will need.

name: Carlos Laso
content: This instructor explains everything in a detailed way. If this keeps up, I will have a great time learning.Indeed, it keeps getting better and better. I have learned a lot about Docker

name: Feliksas Mazeikis
content: The course is hit and miss. While most explanations are clear, the assignments not very well formulated. There's also plenty of diagrams drawn live by hand and it looks very unprofessional and unclear. It might work in front of a live class on a whiteboard, but it does not translate very well into video format. The author also makes false statements during the video and includes the self-correcting comment in text format on the screen instead of re-recording the audio track and not including the mistake in the course in first place.

name: Demetrius Edelin
content: After watching a few other courses on docker and still not get it, it finally clicked for me! Highly recommending this course.

name: Philip Damra
content: The instructor has a very clear style, and the information is clearly organized. Also does an excellent job illustrating real-world scenarios and demonstrating problem solving techniques that you can use to learn what you need to know in order to perform practical tasks.

name: Jorge García
content: very complete course I am happy to have done it :)

name: Jean Heegaard
content: Clear explanations, well toned voice and engaging lectures.Could improve consistency between old and new format of docker commands.

name: Jesse Belcourt
content: Great quality instruction, and well spoken explanations. Lessons cover the things left unspoken in the Docker documentation. Looking forward to finishing this course up and implementing docker in my daily workflow.

name: Jeffrey Gilbert
content: I'm really enjoying Bret's course material.  The assignments are great.  The videos are top notch.  Bret is very professional!

name: David De
content: Loved the course. Already helping devops with our docker infrastructure. Thanks :)

name: Magnus Smith
content: Really well presented.  Enjoying this a lot.  The instructor really knows his stuff.   Would like to see some more examples or assignment on using docker-entrypoint to override runtime behaviour.

name: Mr. Vincent Bortone
content: I've been playing with docker for awhile but this class and it's examples are top notch/  It all just seems to make sense now.

name: Marcio Martins
content: Great course! I think more exercises are needed to help assimilating the concepts (maybe at the end of each section, covering all commands for that section).

name: Brandon Jackson
content: The segment lengths are perfect as are the topics and order. This course is wonderful and a lot of preparation is evident.

name: Bruno Monoue
content: Great course !  I really enjoyed it

name: Mauricio Silva Magalhães
content: Very good course, Bret explains in a simple and objective way.

name: Simon Elliott
content: really great coursethough as someone running docker on windows some of the examples don't work properly.

name: Maxime Bélanger
content: I'm an experimented user and the course is quite good so far. Still, I'm learning new things and I'm excited about the crunchier stuff that is coming up in the next sections.

name: Austin Tindle
content: Absolutely the best, most current, and most comprehensive material available on Docker that I've found anywhere. I purchased both the top Docker courses here on Udemy, and spent weeks trying to understand how to implement Docker into my projects, all with little success. Bret's course is a level above all of those resources, and if you're struggling to get a handle on Docker, this is the resource you need to invest in.

name: Jamie Dockendorff
content: Very good course. I started this course with only the roughest understanding of what Docker was, and I feel confident enough now to do an interview in which Docker is one of the subjects to be covered.

name: Lindison Webb
content: Updated class and informative. The test your knowledge components in the course are way cool. I like that there is a challenge in the course. yay. L

name: Vipin Kumar Sharma
content: Looking for more details on swarm & stack.

name: Philippe Bouchard-Bourdeau
content: Definitely improved my docker skills, now I can't wait to progress further and put it into practice.

name: Kirk Ryan
content: Excellent explanation of the content and the whole course is structured in a way that you can start with zero knowledge of Docker (as I did) and very quickly feel at home with the concepts and skills required to manage your very own environment.

name: Steve Sirag
content: Bret has thorough understanding, but has a good grasp of the complexities of learning this material, explaining each step concisely but completely.

name: Randy Fish
content: I feel like this course really goes in depth on how docker works under the hood and the Assignments are great to synthesize the contents of the lectures.

name: Saúl Martínez
content: The instructions are very clear and understandable. I've tried other docker tutorials and I like the way this course is structured, starting with the in and outs of naked docker commands.

name: Imam Assidiq
content: It goes from zero to awesome, I know a tiny amount of Docker knowledge, but this course tells me everything I need to be a hero on Docker, which is perfect. Congrats on such amazing course :).

name: Brandon Catubig
content: Probably the best Docker course I have taken. Bret does a super job explaining the basics all the way up to more complex Docker topics. I have been able to apply the information I have learned immediately in my day to day job.All concepts are explained in a clear and concise manner. Bret types out most examples by hand and avoids the 'Just run this XZY boilerplate' format. Very engaging and the challenges are fun.

name: Peterson Peter
content: This is the best course on Docker I have seen on Udemy! Take my word for it and buy it.

name: Mohammad Albakri
content: Amazing course so far, really improved my understanding to docker!

name: Mario Guerrero
content: i like the datails about the docker commands and components

name: Brendan Bekowies
content: Clear explanations presented in a way that breaks complicated concepts down into simple, easy to understand logical chunks.  By far the best overview of Docker I have ever come across.  Production quality is excellent as well, which is important for long courses.

name: Marcio Passos Ribeiro
content: Excellent explanations, great labs. I'm very impressed with the overall quality of this course.

name: Zaher Ghaibeh
content: Even though I have not finish the course yet, but I did got so many new tips that I'll be using while working with Docker, but I still find that Docker is not something that you will just learn, its a software that you will always keep reading about to make sure you are covering all the new topic and new techniques they introduce everyday and with every new version.Aye, Aye, Captain

name: Ghislain Bourgeois
content: The course is really complete and very well explained.

name: Ajay Srinivasa
content: I have just finished 2 sections and already feel it is going good. Bret explains concepts briefly first before diving in. Then, during hands on, he goes deeper into every concept. Really liking the course thus far. Will complete the course and add another star based on how it goes.

name: Bret Fisher
content: Thanks a lot, Neil.

name: Bret Fisher
content: Thanks so much, Rizki.

name: Bret Fisher
content: Thanks, Leonid!

name: Bret Fisher
content: Thanks so much, Andy!

name: Bret Fisher
content: Hi Ruben, thanks for the review.1. "Under the hood" is coming in May update!2. Swarm has no built-in auto-scaling, so that likely won't be covered in this course until they add it as an out-of-box feature. But stay tuned, as I eventually will be talking about that on my blog, YouTube, or in another Udemy course maybe. :)

content: Thanks for the kind review, Evren!
